decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly summoning aggressive creatures to overwhelm the opponent and control the board. The key strategy involves using Collected Company to bring in multiple creatures at once, while utilizing powerful cards like Reflector Mage and Spell Queller to disrupt the opponent's plays. The deck also features a mix of removal spells and versatile creatures to adapt to different situations. By effectively managing resources and maintaining board presence, this aggro Bant deck aims to push for a fast victory.

The deck focuses on using ramp spells and mana acceleration to quickly cast powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker. The goal is to control the board through removal spells like Kozilek's Return and Fiery Impulse while also digging through the library with cards like Gather the Pack and Vessel of Nascency. The deck also includes creatures like Ishkanah, Grafwidow and Dragonlord Atarka for additional control and power. By ramping up mana quickly, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with big threats and efficient removal.

The main focus of this deck is to establish control over the game by utilizing a combination of counter spells, removal, and powerful creatures. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Spatial Contortion, Spell Shrivel, and Clash of Wills, while also ramping up mana with cards like Hedron Archive and Shrine of the Forsaken Gods to play big threats like Ulamog and Emrakul. The deck also features planeswalkers like Chandra and Jace to provide additional card advantage and board control.

This deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. It leverages cards like Thing in the Ice and Thermo-Alchemist to deal consistent damage while maintaining card advantage through draw spells like Tormenting Voice and Collective Defiance. Unsubstantiate and Dispel provide protection for your creatures and spells, while Fevered Visions puts pressure on the opponent to draw cards. The mana base is streamlined for consistency with a mix of Mountains, Islands, and dual lands like Wandering Fumeral and Shivan Reef.

This deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's strategy with removal spells like Ultimate Price, Grasp of Darkness, and Ruinous Path, while also maintaining control with planeswalkers like Liliana, the Last Hope and Chandra, Flamecaller. The deck also includes card advantage and selection with Read the Bones and Transgress the Mind. The win condition is to outvalue your opponent with threats like Kalitas, Traitor of Ghet and Goblin Dark-Dwellers, while also having utility lands like Blighted Fen to further control the game.

The main concept of this Bant Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of creatures and spells that put pressure on the opponent while maintaining board control. Utilizing the mana base of Yavimaya Coast, Prairie Stream, and others, the deck aims to efficiently cast creatures like Duskwatch Recruiter, Spell Queller, and Sylvan Advocate. Collected Company provides additional creature value, while Declaration in Stone and Dromoka's Command offer removal and utility. Overall, the deck focuses on aggression, tempo, and flexibility to outpace and outlast the opponent.

This deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent by utilizing aggressive creatures and burn spells. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with a constant stream of damage while also controlling the board with removal spells. By efficiently using its resources and taking advantage of the aggressive nature of Red Deck Wins archetype, this deck aims to finish the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize. The key strategy involves applying pressure early and maintaining tempo throughout the game to secure a victory.

This deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with aggressive creatures like Lambholt Pacifist and Thalia's Lieutenant, supported by control elements like Reflector Mage and Thalia, Heretic Cathar. Collected Company and Dromoka's Command provide additional value and flexibility in combat situations. Tamiyo, Field Researcher offers card advantage and synergy with the deck's creatures. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive creatures while also providing access to the necessary colors for the deck's spells. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its efficient creatures and disruptive spells.

The main concept of this Rakdos Aggro deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent using cheap discard spells like Collective Brutality and Fiery Temper, along with efficient burn spells like Incendiary Flow and Lightning Axe. Cards like Thermo-Alchemist and Bedlam Reveler help keep the pressure on while also providing card advantage. The deck aims to use its low-cost threats and disruptive spells to control the board and finish off the opponent before they can stabilize. The mana base is built to support the deck's aggressive game plan by providing consistent access to its spells.

The main focus of this Bant Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent quickly with a combination of efficient creatures like Duskwatch Recruiter, Sylvan Advocate, and Tireless Tracker, backed up by disruptive spells like Reflector Mage and Spell Queller. The deck aims to maintain tempo and apply pressure on the opponent through a combination of card advantage with Collected Company and removal with Declaration in Stone. The mana base is designed to support the deck's colors while providing flexibility for early plays and ensuring consistent land drops.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana and filling the graveyard to take advantage of emerge creatures. By utilizing cards like Vessel of Nascency, Grapple with the Past, and Traverse the Ulvenwald, the deck can efficiently search for key creatures like Wretched Gryff, Ishkanah, Grafwidow, and eventually Emrakul, the Promised End to overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats. Combined with Kozilek's Return for board control and Elder Deep-Fiend to disrupt the opponent's strategy, this deck aims to quickly apply pressure and dominate the game.

This Bant Aggro deck focuses on maintaining a strong board presence through aggressive creatures like Sylvan Advocate and Selfless Spirit, while also utilizing disruptive cards like Spell Queller and Reflector Mage to control the opponent's board. The deck aims to quickly develop its board state and overwhelm the opponent with creatures, while still having access to powerful cards like Collected Company to refill the board. With a mixture of creatures, control elements, and card advantage, this deck combines aggression with versatility to outpace and outmaneuver opponents.

This deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with efficient creatures and disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Reflector Mage and Spell Queller. It utilizes cards like Collected Company to help flood the board with creatures and provide card advantage. The deck also includes a mix of removal and combat tricks to maintain control of the battlefield. The mana base is designed to support the deck's mana requirements while still allowing for consistent plays. Ultimately, the deck's goal is to overwhelm the opponent with early aggression and versatile threats.

The deck focuses on utilizing green ramp cards to quickly accelerate mana production in order to cast powerful spells such as Emrakul, the Promised End and Crush of Tentacles. The control aspect comes from cards like Jace, Unraveler of Secrets and Den Protector to disrupt opponent's strategies and maintain board dominance. The deck also includes card draw spells like Pieces of the Puzzle to ensure consistency in drawing key pieces of the combo. Overall, the strategy revolves around overwhelming opponents with big threats while controlling the game with disruptive spells.

The deck focuses on aggressive plays with a mix of creatures and spells to pressure the opponent early on. It utilizes cards like Collected Company and Reflector Mage to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy while also maintaining a strong board presence with creatures like Sylvan Advocate and Tireless Tracker. The deck aims to quickly build a board advantage and overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize, using cards like Archangel Avacyn and Dromoka's Command for additional utility and protection.

The deck focuses on aggressive gameplay by utilizing a mix of creatures with disruptive abilities and tempo plays to control the board while quickly applying pressure on the opponent. The deck includes powerful creatures like Archangel Avacyn and Elder Deep-Fiend alongside disruptive spells like Reflector Mage and Spell Queller. Collected Company provides additional creature advantage, while Tamiyo, Field Researcher adds card advantage and flexibility. By combining aggression with disruption and tempo, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents and secure victory through a versatile and dynamic playstyle.

The main concept of this Bant Aggro deck is to quickly assemble a board presence of creatures with strong synergy and tempo advantage. By utilizing cards like Reflector Mage, Spell Queller, and Selfless Spirit to disrupt the opponent's strategy while building up the board with creatures like Sylvan Advocate and Tireless Tracker, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and maintain control of the battlefield. The deck also includes cards like Collected Company and Declaration in Stone for additional utility and removal options. With a mix of creatures and spells, this deck aims to maintain pressure and tempo throughout the game.

The core idea of this deck is to have a strong aggressive presence on the battlefield by utilizing creatures and planeswalkers in the Selesnya colors. The deck focuses on playing powerful threats like Hangarback Walker, Gideon, Ally of Zendikar, and Nissa, Voice of Zendikar to quickly overwhelm the opponent. Cards like Sylvan Advocate and Noose Constrictor help to support the aggressive strategy, while removal spells like Stasis Snare and Dromoka's Command provide additional versatility. The inclusion of Archangel Avacyn adds a powerful finisher to the deck, ensuring that it can maintain pressure throughout the game.

The main concept of this Bant Aggro deck is to apply early pressure on the opponent with efficient creatures like Sylvan Advocate and Reflector Mage, while also maintaining tempo with cards like Spell Queller and Collected Company. The deck also utilizes disruptive spells like Declaration in Stone and Dromoka's Command to control the board. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Selfless Spirit and Archangel Avacyn provide protection for the player's creatures and potential blowout plays. The deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent and maintain board control to secure a victory.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of low-cost creatures, buffed by cards like Thalia's Lieutenant and Always Watching. Kytheon and other aggressive creatures like Dragon Hunter and Reckless Bushwhacker provide early pressure, while Declaration in Stone helps to remove any threats from the opposing board. The mana base is optimized for a fast and consistent start, utilizing Needle Spires for additional damage potential. Overall, the goal is to maintain a steady stream of aggressive threats to outpace the opponent and secure a swift victory.
